intro: Chaerophyllum orizabae, commonly known as the Mexican cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, oval fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
